{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is about post-extraction bleeding in a leukemia patient. Leukemia is a condition characterized by an abnormal increase of white blood cells in the blood. This would imply that the increased leukocyte count may be contributing to the bleeding issue. However, platelet disorder is also a common complication of leukemia, which could also cause prolonged bleeding. Clotting factors deficiency is not directly related to leukemia. Calcium levels are not typically associated with bleeding issues. Therefore, the most likely cause of post-extraction bleeding in this patient is a platelet disorder.", "answer_choice": C}
